quotes.quote: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
Your health account, your bank account, they're the same thing. The more you put in, the more you can take out. Exercise is king and nutrition is queen. Together you have a kingdom.
We are the custodians of our bodies. We must take action to employ healthy lifestyle habits to prevent, reduce, and/or manage disease and illness.
To enjoy the glow of good health, you must exercise.
Biceps are like ornaments on a Christmas tree.
I know that if I set my mind to something, even if people are saying I can't do it, I will achieve it.
You're going to have to let it hurt. Let it suck. The harder you work, the better you will look. Your appearance isn't parallel to how heavy you lift, it's parallel to how hard you work.
Eating healthy nutritious food is the simple and right solution to get rid of excess body weight effortlessly and become slim and healthy forever.
I don't do this to be healthy, I do this to get big muscles.
In training, you listen to your body. In competition, you tell your body to shut up.
The best activities for your health are pumping and humping.
May I have more please? May I have more pain? May I have more torture? Because I know this shit is gonna make me grow!
There's more to life than training, but training is what puts more in your life.
As your training moves from base training to more intense work, to tapering, your nutrition needs to change.
I'm not sold on one diet philosophy. I'm sold on whatever will work for you.
Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity.
The purpose of training is to tighten up the slack, toughen the body, and polish the spirit.
If a man achieves victory over this body, who in the world can exercise power over him? He who rules himself rules over the whole world.
When working out, length is not a substitute for intensity.
There is no such thing as over training, just under nutrition and under sleeping.
Life is one big gym where we need to constantly workout to stay fit for this world. And indeed love here is the treadmill.
A dream doesn't become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
Weight loss doesn't begin in the gym with a dumb bell; it starts in your head with a decision.
A fit, healthy bodyâ€”that is the best fashion statement.
Success isn't given. It's earned. In the kitchen, in the gym, in the workout, all day. With blood, sweat, and the occasional tear.
There's no secret formula. I lift heavy, work hard, and aim to be the best.
Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
If you ever lack the motivation to train then think what happens to your mind and body when you don't.
Squat like Channing Tatum is watching.
Fitness is not 30% gym and 70% diet. It's 100% dedication to the gym and your diet!
A feeble body weakens the mind.
It's easier to stay in shape if you never let yourself get out of shape in the first place.
You shall gain, but you shall pay with sweat, blood, and vomit.
Exercise is done against one's wishes and maintained only because the alternative is worse.
Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is strength.
Bodybuilding is much like any other sport. To be successful, you must dedicate yourself 100% to your training, diet and mental approach.
Before you worry about the beauty of your body, worry about the health of your body.
Fitness is not about being better than someone else. It's about being better than you used to be.
Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
If a man tells you he doesn't lift because he doesn't want to get too bulky, then his testicles have been removed.
True enjoyment comes from activity of the mind and exercise of the body; the two are ever united.
The last three or four reps is what makes the muscle grow. This area of pain divides the champion from someone else who is not a champion.
Stay hungry, stay healthy, be a gentleman, believe strongly in yourself and go beyond limitations.
Today it hurts. Tomorrow it works.
Sell yourself short on nutrition and you're selling yourself short on maximizing your physique development.
Diet food is not a meal its a medicine.
You have to push past your perceived limits, push past that point you thought was as far as you can go.

I'm not in the best shape, but I want to prove to myself I can do something that seems insurmountable and inspire others by showing them no matter where they are in their fitness goals, they can do it, too.
There are no shortcutsâ€”everything is reps, reps, reps.
I don't believe in bodybuilders using steroids. If a man doesn't have enough male hormones in his system to create, a nice hard, muscular body, he should take up ping pong.
